message.content:
cs.PL, cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.CL, cs.LG. 

The paper proposes an extension to logic programming languages to allow for more versatile interactions with the user, which is a topic that falls under the sub-categories of programming languages (cs.PL), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), human-computer interaction (cs.HC), computational linguistics (cs.CL), and machine learning (cs.LG). Given that the paper focuses on logic programming, cs.PL is the most likely sub-category, followed by cs.AI and cs.HC, which are relevant to the interactive aspect of the proposed extension. Cs.CL and cs.LG are less likely but still possible sub-categories, as they are related to natural language processing and machine learning, which could be used in conjunction with the proposed extension.
